instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Display issue
threads.message: Hey, another mess h20 board, first it was burned down screen connector, i changed them and <CHIP>U8400</CHIP>, now i have macbook booting and showing external monitor, but not reqionize internal, where to start, tryed 3 different working displays.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Display issue
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Display issue
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Display issue
threads.message:
Do you get 3V3/<SIGNAL>5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL>, at least in the first seconds, when machine chimes?
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> must go high at same time.
